intro: Guatteria caniflora var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, typically found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically less than 10 cm in width. It produces small, white to pale green flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on short pedicels. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds, and the plant is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
